#Text=Viñales
#Text=Viñales is a beautiful and lush valley in Pinar del Río province of Cuba , with a population of around 10,000 .
#Text=It 's about 26 km north of the city of Pinar del Río , and was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site .
#Text=This article also covers the town by the same name .
#Text=The mountains are beautiful , the farmers grow the best tobacco , and tourists come every day by the busload .
#Text=Landscape
#Text=Cuba was once covered by limestone ( " karst " ) .
#Text=Much of this limestone has eroded away , leaving mountains with steep sides and rounded , jungly tops .
#Text=The mountains are called mogotes , which means " haystacks . "
#Text=Many mogotes have caves .
#Text=Several caves are developed for tourists to visit .
#Text=The red farmland and unique microclimate produce the best cigars in the world .
#Text=Some tobacco farms are set up for tourist tours .
#Text=People
#Text=Start at a tourist office or your hotel or casa particular .
#Text=Point out something in the guidebook you 'd like to see or do , and offer to pay someone to take you there .
#Text=Or offer to pay for a Spanish lesson or a salsa lesson .

#Text=Hire a local guide for a few hours and you 'll make a friend , and he or she will introduce you to his or her family , and they 'll invite you to do more stuff , and you wo n't be bored the rest of your visit .
#Text=But be aware of what 's illegal to pay for .
#Text=You ca n't pay someone to drive you somewhere , unless it 's a licensed taxi .
#Text=You ca n't pay for lodging , unless it 's a licensed casa particulares ( bed&breakfast ) .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Viazul runs buses twice a day between Havana ( 12 CUC ) via Pinar del Rio .
#Text=There ’s an early morning bus to Cienfuegos and Trinidad .
#Text=Buses arrive and leave opposite of the ticket office near the central town square .
#Text=Viazul ticket office , Salvador Cisneros , 63 A ( on main street opposite town square ) .
#Text=Open daily .
#Text=They will book your bus to Havana , and can organize transfers in smaller coaches to Soroa , Las Terrazas and other locations .
#Text=By shared taxi
#Text=You will likely be offered a collectivo already at the Havana bus station .
#Text=They run to Viñales for 20 CUC per person .
#Text=Transport back can also be found by taxi touts near the Viazul ticket office .
#Text=One typically inquires at least a day before the intended departure to make a taxi reservation .
#Text=The driver will then pick you up at your casa .
#Text=It is easiest to find a transport for morning departures .
#Text=Collectivos also run to other destinations such as Cienfuegos ( 40 CUC )
#Text=Trinidad ( 40 CUC or more ) if there is sufficient demand .

#Text=Beware that taxi drivers will sometimes claim to have transport to Trinidad or Cienfuegos , but in fact require a change of vehicle in Havana , which may involve re-negotiating the price for the remaining trip .
#Text=Shared taxis
#Text=for Pinar del Rio
#Text=( at the south junction of the main street ) .
#Text=These run relatively frequently and depart on demand once the car is full .
#Text=1 CUC .
#Text=Fees and permits
#Text=Entrance to the valley is free .
#Text=Some attractions like the Cueva de la piscina will charge a fee though .
#Text=Viñales
#Text=The town is easily walkable on foot .

#Text=Most amenities such as banks and restaurants cluster on the main street ( Salvador Cisneros ) and accommodation is found everywhere off this street , esp Calle Rafael Trejo which runs on south parallel to the main street essentially only consists of casas particulares .
#Text=The valley
#Text=There is a green minibus that takes tourists around the valley .
#Text=For 5 CUC you can ride all day , with stops at the tourist hotels , in the village , at the caves and other sights .
#Text=Many sights are in the proximity of the city and not more than 4km away .
#Text=As such it ’s possible to walk , also riding on a bike or a horse may be less strenous esp . considering the often very hot weather .
#Text=Other sights such as the Santo Tomás cave are further away and out of walking distance .
#Text=To get there hire a cab , rent a bike or join an organized tour .
#Text=See
#Text=Calle Salvador Cisneros .
#Text=The main street was named after Salvador Cisneros Betancourt , who was a leader in the war of independence ( 1868-1878 ) and later was President of Cuba from 1895 to 1897 .
#Text=Today it ’s more and more covered with all sorts of restaurants that cater to tourists .
#Text=Casa de la Cultura .
#Text=In the central plaza , the Casa de la Cultura puts on events every day ( or night ) , including music , fashion shows , and children 's events .
#Text=cover charge typically ~1 CUC .
#Text=The Central plaza .
#Text=Also on the central plaza is an art gallery and the church .
#Text=On Saturday mornings there 's a farmer 's market at the plaza .
#Text=Museo Municipal ( further down the main street ) .
#Text=The small museo municipal , former home of independence heroine Adela Azcuy .
#Text=Around Viñales
#Text=Parque Nacional
#Text=Vinales visitor centre
#Text=.
#Text=The park covers 150 km ² and the visitor centre located close to the hotel Los Jazmines offers information , hiking and guides .
#Text=( 2 km from Vinales ) .
#Text=The visitor centre does not have a lot to see , some wall charts with walking routes and a small model of the valley .
#Text=It is the view that is stunning and from here you can organise your excursions into the valley .
#Text=Mural de la Prehistoria .
#Text=Perhaps the worst tourist attraction in Cuba .
#Text=In 1961 Fidel Castro visited the beautiful valley of the two sisters ( Valley de Dos Hermanas ) 3 km west of Viñales .
#Text=He commissioned a cliff to be painted with snails , dinosaurs , and a family of cavepersons , in garish colors !
#Text=There 's a restaurant , bar , and gift shop .
#Text=To be fair , reputedly , the food in the restaurant is excellent and the live music is good .
#Text=Also there 's horseback riding .
#Text=So consider visiting the mural and doing something other than looking at the mural .
#Text=You do n’t need to pay the entrance fee to see the painted mountain cliff , its visible from the road already .
#Text=El Palenque de los Cimarrones .
#Text=Tiny museum as you walk through a smaller cave ( Cueva de San Miguel ) showing how slaves hid out in centuries past .
#Text=Restaurant at back with slave show , mostly for bus tours .
#Text=Cave is best known for its disco at the weekends where all the locals go to hang out .
#Text=Food also served .
#Text=( 4km from Vinales )
